pr_title: FISH-660 Upgrade MicroProfile Health Implementation to 3.0-RC5

timeline.bodyText:
Can't wrap my head around this one. How is an empty modifiable map of any use? Why would a concurrent map be wrong in a shared service? How is this only applying to health and not equally to readiness and liveness?
Maybe you can shine some light on this for me.
timeline.author: jbee

replies.bodyText: I did it in the interest of "non invasive changes" whilst still trying to make it clear that this isn't modified anymore. Perhaps it would be more readable if I just use an explicit new HashMap each time instead. I'll refactor this
replies.author: MattGill98

timeline.message:
FISH-660 Upgrade MicroProfile Health to 3.0-RC5

@Health annotation has been removed, so the backward compatibility flag
has also been removed.

Signed-off-by: Matthew Gill <matthew.gill@live.co.uk>

FISH-660 Fix MicroProfile Health Configuration Name

This is a breaking change, but the MP health configuration was
incorrectly called "metrics-healthcheck-configuration" which was
confusing.

Signed-off-by: Matthew Gill <matthew.gill@live.co.uk>

FISH-660 Fix MicroProfile Health Configuration Name

This is a breaking change, but the MP health configuration was
incorrectly called "metrics-healthcheck-configuration" which was
confusing.

Signed-off-by: Matthew Gill <matthew.gill@live.co.uk>

FISH-660 Remove Old MP Health Watches

Monitoring still collected Health data, which has been removed. The
'overall' metric has also been renamed to health as it now feels more
appropriate.

Signed-off-by: Matthew Gill <matthew.gill@live.co.uk>
Merge branch 'FISH-660' of github.com:MattGill98/Payara into FISH-660

FISH-660 Reconcile master merge with Health Upgrade

Conflicts arose caused by FISH-327 MP Sniffers. These are integrated
into the Health upgrade.

Signed-off-by: Matthew Gill <matthew.gill@live.co.uk>
